ext_desc.message: Track app performance and user happiness for all your web apps in real-time using $PERFORMANCE_TRACKER$ and $ERROR_TRACKER$. Now with $HEROKU$ support!

ext_headline.message: $EXT_NAME$ gives you instant status on all your misbehaving web-apps in one easy extension.

ext_welcome_first_step.message: In order to achieve application-tracking nirvana, you’re going to enter a few API-related settings on the next screen:

edit_settings.description: Button label to let the user edit her settings

save_settings.description: Button label to let the user save her settings

back.description: button to go back to previous screen

performance_API_key_location_help.message: (Log in to $PERFORMANCE_TRACKER$ to get your API key.)
performance_API_key_location_help.description: tell user where to find their API key

error_API_key_location_help.message: (Log in to $ERROR_TRACKER$ to get your API key.)
error_API_key_location_help.description: tell user where to find their API key

choose_app_to_monitor.description: let user choose an application from a list

for.description: as in, 'this is used FOR that.'

primary_app_selector_menu_label.description: show the user which of their apps will be displayed.

review_us.message: You should rate us positively here!
review_us.description: request the user to review this extension (eg. 'Five stars!'

long_description_p1.message: $PERFORMANCE_TRACKER$ is an awesome analytics / monitoring service for server side developers, dev-ops folks, and network engineers, and $ERROR_TRACKER$ from $ERROR_TRACKER_MAKER$ is a killer way to manage error notifications for your $FRAMEWORK$ apps. The problem is that $PERFORMANCE_TRACKER$ only works if you watch it like a hawk, and $ERROR_TRACKER$ fills up your inbox with errors — not cool.

long_description_p2.message: Now, with $EXT_NAME$, you can get up to the second app performance stats from your API or web application, all without leaving $DISTRACTING_WEBSITE$ (or whatever else you're browsing).

long_description_p3.message: We use an HTTPS connection to connect to $PERFORMANCE_TRACKER$'s API securely and display your apps' performance metrics in context. We also display real-time $HOST_BROWSER$ notifications via $ERROR_TRACKER$ when your app encounters a production error. Monitor up to 10 apps at once.

long_description_p4.message: $EXT_NAME$ can track apps written in Erlang, Java, Javascript, MySQL, PHP, Python, Ruby, Rails, Redis, or Scala, hosted on Apache, Nginx, Node.js, Unicorn, or Phusion Passenger web application servers.
